property.filterExpression: datagrp=='BROCADE_FCSWITCH_PORT' | datagrp=='BROCADE_FCSWITCH_SYSTEM' | datagrp=='BROCADE_GENERIC_INTERFACES' | datagrp=='BROCADE_ACCESSGATEWAY_SYSTEM' | datagrp=='BROCADE_ACCESSGATEWAY_PORT' | model='%Brocade%' | model='%brocade%'

property.description:
The current operational status of the switch.

The states are as follow:

  • online(100%) means the switch is accessible by an external Fibre Channel port;
  • offline(0%) means the switch is not accesible;
  • testing(NaN) means the switch is in a built-in test mode and is not accessible by an external Fibre Channel port;
  • faulty(50%) means the switch is not operational.

property.displayedProperties: partform[Sensor type] partstat[Sensor status] partsn[Sensor info]
device maxspeed part[Interface Description] ifacemac[Interface Mac address] ifaceip iftype

property.description: This report displays the Throughput by port type. Typically, this is the sum of throughput for all FC ports belonging to switches regarding the port type.
This report displays the Throughput by switches. Typically, this is the sum of throughput for all FC ports belonging to a switch.
This report displays the switches summary and their main KPIs.

property.displayedProperties: partwwn[Port wwn] ifname[Port specifier] linkstat[Port link state] partphys[Port physical state] partstat[Port admin. status] part[Port name] maxspeed[Port speed] porttype[Port type]

node.name: Nb. no TX buffer credit lost

property.filterExpression: name=='InFramesTruncated' | name=='InFramesTooLongs' | name=='InFramesBadEofs' | name=='InBadOs' | name=='InFramesEncodingErrors' | name=='InCrcs' | name=='OutFramesEncodingErrors' | name=='LinkFailures' | name=='SyncLosses' | name=='SigLosses' | name=='C3Discards' | name=='CreditLost' | name=='ProtoErrors' | name=='AddressIdErrors' | name=='LinkResetIns' | name=='LinkResetOuts' | name=='LinkFailures' | name=='InvalidTxWords' | name=='TooManyRDY'

property.description:
• Link Failures : It indicates the number of times the Fibre Channel connectivity with the port was “broken” during that sampling interval when the port observes errors for a sustained time interval and was online.
  • Sync Losses:Loss of Synchronization indicates the number of times the port went into the “loss of synchronization” state where it encountered continuous Disparity errors during that sampling interval.
  • Signal Losses:Loss of Signal is the number times the port detected a loss of the electrical or optical signal used to transfer data on the port during that sampling interval.
  • CRC Errors:CRC Errors is the number of Fibre Channel frames handled by the port that containing checksum errors during that sampling period. Typically the error is recovered by retransmitting the frame and the error will go unnoticed by the device connected to the port.
The Name Server Database report displays all name server entries. The name server stores name entries for all hosts in the Fibre Channel Network Switch (FCNS) database.

property.displayedProperties: device ip devdesc devstat[Device status] firmware[Firmware version] devicesn[Soft serial number] maxport[FC port capacity] bootdate[Last boot date] domainid[Domain ID]

property.description: This report displays the Throughput by domains. Typically, this is the sum of throughput for all FC ports belonging to switches regarding the domain id.

This report shows Inter-Switch-Link (ISL) trunking resource usage. ISL monitoring helps administrators determine the sources of traffic on ISLs and identify potential points of congestion within the SAN fabric. ISL is based on the expansion port (E_Port). E_port is the connection between 2 fibre channel switches. When E_ports between two switches form a link, that link is referred to as an inter-switch link (ISL).

SAN Resources.

This report lists all the interfaces. Click on an interface to display the bandwidth utilization over time.

Loopback interfaces are excluded by default.

property.filterExpression: parttype=='Port' & (name=='C3Discards' | name=='CreditLost' | name=='InCrcs' | name=='InFramesTruncated' | name=='OutFramesEncodingErrors' | name=='InBadOs' | name=='InFramesBadEofs' | name=='InFramesEncodingErrors' | name=='InFramesLinkControl' | name=='InFramesTooLongs' | name=='TooManyRDY' | name=='LinkFailures' | name=='InvalidTxWords' | name=='SyncLosses' | name=='SigLosses' | name=='ProtoErrors' | name=='AddressIdErrors' | name=='LinkResetIns' | name=='LinkResetOuts')

property.description: This report shows which switch has FC ports errors. The "Errors on FC Ports?" column indicates errors that are occurred on FC ports. When the column displays a Red Bullet that means one error KPIs has got data. Green means no errors. This report is using the max aggregation for all errors KPIs on each ports.

This report shows which FC port has errors. The "Errors Detected?" column indicates errors that are occurred. When the column displays a Red Bullet that means one error KPIs has got data. Green means no errors. This report is using the max aggregation for all errors KPIs.
